channel.title: Posts on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Github Pages & Hugo - A tutorial
item.description: Making a Github Pages site with Hugo was a struggle! But my boyfriend Jacob and I made with work with the help of these resources https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/ https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/creating-a-github-pages-site https://freshman.tech/web-development-with-go/ https://blog.clairvoyantsoft.com/create-a-static-website-with-hugo-and-host-it-with-github-pages-f268b12371 After 5 hours of working on it, we sorted out that a structure like this (screenshot of and link to private repo) https://github.com/m4gg13/m4gg13.github.io-private (screenshot of and link to public repo) https://github.com/m4gg13/m4gg13.github.io made sense for the Hugo workflow. Note: The repos’ structures might have changed since this post was made.

item.title: Particle Sandbox - Identifying a simulation algorithm
item.description: I’ve got some education on the subject of programming a quantum computer. Used Qiskit as well as OpenQASM. I have less education on the subject of particle physics but I do love the particle physics at a high level. I’ve become somewhat familiar with it through comsuming relevant media like: field guide to particle physics that one mindscape episode and other ones too wiki pages youtube videos Thought a good first step would be looking into what kinds of algorithms get used in quantum particle simulations.

item.title: Particle Sandbox - Project Definition
item.description: A… description of what this project is all about

item.title: Perennial Philosophy & its pitfalls
item.description: It is of course a good habit to look for reasons why the things you think might be wrong. Doing so can help you understand people who think differently than you as well as give you the chance to strengthen or evolve your beliefs. I find that at this point in my life I am inclined to believe that all religions point to the same truth underneath. Wikipedia told me that this is called Perennial Philosophy.

item.title: Pursuit of Knowledge
item.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mysticism another way (beside philosophy) of addressing fundamental questions like existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language mysticism is differentiated from philosophy in that philosopohy requires systematic and logical analysis of language and clarification of the meaning of words and concepts while mysticism and religion focus more on “the Absolute or the Infinite” perennial philosophy: the idea that religious traditions share a singl, metaphysical truth or origin universalism is the idea that all religions point to the same Truth “The Perennial Philosophy” by Aldour Huxley, 1945.
